metadata.title: CVE-2024-42295 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nilfs2: handle inconsistent state in nilfs_btnode_create_block()Syzbot reported that a buffer state inconsistency was detected innilfs_btnode_create_block(), triggering a kernel bug.It is not appropriate to treat this inconsistency as a bug; it can occurif the argument block address (the buffer index of the newly createdblock) is a virtual block number and has been reallocated due tocorruption of the bitmap used to manage its allocation state.So, modify nilfs_btnode_create_block() and its callers to treat it as apossible filesystem error, rather than triggering a kernel bug.
